result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Lee Ashley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any sentence; release for work and inmate work assignments; credit for 4 days (04-16-2015 to 04-19-2015). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any cash bail on deposit to apply.Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Fine set at ZERO.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin Lee Ashley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order signed and filed. tk 
It is hereby Ordered:
The petition is granted.
The security precautions are waived. The defendant shall be released no later than 9:00 am on 11-3-2015 and shall return to the jail or house of correction no later than 2:30 pm on 11-03-2015.  The defendant shall be monitored by GPS. The defendant shall remain absolutely sober and comply with all ruled of the Correctional Facility that is responsible for the defendant's custody. THe defendant must travel directly to/from Christian Faith Fellowship Church.  No other stops allowed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 80 DAYS  in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for work and inmate work assignments; credit for 4 days (04-16-2015 to 04-19-2015). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 1 YEARS with the following conditions:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety:  No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/ Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any cash bail on deposit to apply.Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Melvin Lee Ashley in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor. Brandon Wigley on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 22, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Melvin Lee Ashley in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report date May 18, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Melvin Lee Ashley in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ronald Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/27/15.

15RM020511  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/19/2015

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY INCLUDING DRUG TESTING. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription,
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Melvin Lee Ashley in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Melvin Lee Ashley in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
